bibl.title: An Early Roman Bowl from the Monastery of Pachomius at Pbow and the Milieu of the Nag Hammadi Codices.
bibl.note: Compares a bowl that had been used as a lid to seal the jar in which the Nag Hammadi codices had been buried and a similar bowl unearthed in the archeological excavations at the great fifth century basilica of the central Pachomian monastery of Pbow. The two bowl indicate that the Pachomian monks and the owners of the Nag Hammadi codices shared a broader common material culture.
